net.gliblybits.bitsengine.utils

Class BitsFixedSizeArray<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gliblybits.bitsengine.utils.BitsFixedSizeArray<T>

  • public class BitsFixedSizeArray<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    The BitsFixedSizeArray is a faster way to store values in a collection
    without using the new statement and force the garbage collection to do
    its work.

    Since:
    0.1 - Streak
    Version:
    0.1 - Streak
    Author:
    Marc Wiedenhoeft - GliblyBits

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitsFixedSizeArray(int size)
      The constructor creates the array with the given size.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(T object)
      Inserts a new object into the array.
      void clear()
      Clears the contents of the array, releasing all references to objects it contains and
      setting its count to zero.
      int find(T object)
      Searches the array for the specified object.
      T get(int index)
      Returns an entry from the array at the specified index.
      T[] getArray()
      Returns the raw internal array.
      int getCapacity()
      Returns the maximum number of objects that can be inserted inot this array.
      int getCount()
      Returns the number of objects in the array.
      void remove(int index)
      Removes the specified index from the array.
      void remove(T object)
      Searches for an object and removes it from the array if it is found.
      T removeLast()
      Removes the last element in the array and returns it.
      void set(int index, T object)
      Sets the value of a specific index in the array.
      void swapWithLast(int index)
      Swaps the element at the passed index with the element at the end of the array.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitsFixedSizeArray

        public BitsFixedSizeArray(int size)
        The constructor creates the array with the given size.
        The size must be > 0. Otherwise an error will be logged and
        a runtime exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        size - - must be > 0

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public final void add(T object)
        Inserts a new object into the array.
        If the array is full, an assert is thrown and the
        object is ignored.

      • remove

        public final void remove(T object)
        Searches for an object and removes it from the array if it is found.
        Other indexes in the array are shifted up to fill the space left by the removed object.

      • remove

        public final void remove(int index)
        Removes the specified index from the array.
        Subsequent entries in the array are shifted up
        to fill the space.

      • removeLast

        public T removeLast()
        Removes the last element in the array and returns it.
        This method is faster than calling remove(count -1).

        Returns:
        The contents of the last element in the array. Null if there is no element left.

      • swapWithLast

        public final void swapWithLast(int index)
        Swaps the element at the passed index with the element at the end of the array.
        When followed by removeLast(), this is useful for quickly removing array elements.

      • set

        public final void set(int index,
       T object)
        Sets the value of a specific index in the array.
        An object must have already been added to
        the array at that index for this command to complete.

      • clear

        public final void clear()
        Clears the contents of the array, releasing all references to objects it contains and
        setting its count to zero.

      • get

        public final T get(int index)
        Returns an entry from the array at the specified index.

      • find

        public final int find(T object)
        Searches the array for the specified object.

        Parameters:
        object - The object to search for.
        Returns:
        The index of the object in the array, or -1 if the object is not found.

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Returns the number of objects in the array.

      • getCapacity

        public final int getCapacity()
        Returns the maximum number of objects that can be inserted inot this array.

      • getArray

        public final T[] getArray()
        Returns the raw internal array. Exposed here so that tight loops can cache this array and walk it without the overhead of repeated function calls. Beware that changing this array can leave FixedSizeArray in an undefined state, so this function is potentially dangerous and should be used in read-only cases.
        Returns:
        The internal storage array.
